View vNode Details

Use this task to view vNode operational information.

  1. From the navigation bar, select Devices > Node Details.
  2. The Node Details window displays as shown below:
  3. Click the Select vBBU drop-down list to select the vBBU ID to which a vNode is associated.
  4. Click the Select vNode drop-down list to select the vNode associated with the vBBU that you want to view. The vNode that you select displays in the Node Details window.
  5. In the Software Details section, view the vBBU system fields that are described in the table below:

    Field

    Description
    vNode Name

    The vNode ID that you selected, which is made up of the device ID (Organization Unique Identifier OUI, for example 41733, which is Parallel Wireless), device product hardware Class ID, for example C19999, and device serial number associated with this vNode.

    The first part of the device serial number is the vBBU serial number (that can be found on the device itself), followed by the pre-provisioned vNode number (for example 03) and is followed next the cellular technology (2G or 4G). This ID is also the UniRAN ID for the vNode. For example:

    S3837C2X1113972-03-4G
    Region

    Displays the configured geographical region in which this vBBU site exists that serves this vNode.
    Site Displays the specific physical location of the vBBU that serves this vNode.
    Software Build Date Displays when the vBBU software was released.
    System Boot Time Displays the last time the vNode was rebooted.
    Machine Type Displays the general type of server by processor. For example, x86_64.
    OS Name Displays the type of Linux operating system. For example, CentOs Linux.
    OS Release Displays the Linux operating system release. For example, 7.4.1708.
    Software Version Displays the vBBU software version.
  6. Scroll down the page. The Service Details section is used to view the vNode connection status to the PW EMS and its IP connectivity to northbound entities.

    Field

    Description
    Status Displays the connection status of the vNode. For example, One-way connected or bidirectional.
    RAT Mode Displays whether the Radio Access Technology (RAT) mode is 4G (LTE) or 2G (GSM). For example, if it is LTE it will also state if Option 8 is supported, which would indicate that this vNode supports 2 4G LTE cells.
    Hardware Class ID

    This is the vBBU device ID that is associated with this vNode. For example: C19999
    UNIRAN ID

    This ID contains the vBBU device serial number, followed by the pre-provisioned vNode number (for example 03) and is followed next by the cellular technology (2G or 4G).

    S3837C2X1113972-03-4G
    WAN IP Address Allocation Indicates whether the Wide Area Network (WAN) or Internet IP address is assigned manually (static) or dynamically (through DHCP).
    WAN Gateway IP Address Displays the WAN gateway IP address of the vBBU used to connect to the Internet.
    IPSec Displays whether the IPsec tunnel between the vBBU and PW EMS is Enabled or Disabled.
    IPSec Address Allocation Indicates whether the IPsec address is assigned manually (static) or dynamically (through DHCP).
    IPSec Address Indicates the IPSec tunnel IP address.
    Fronthaul Interface Indicates the vNode fronthaul interface between it and the cell.
    Certificate Serial Number Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) unique identifier for each certificate generated by a trusted Certificate Authoritiy (CA).
    Certificate Issuer The trusted PKI CA that issued the certificate.
    Certificate Begin Period The date start entry for when the certificate is valid.
    Certificate End Period The date end entry for when the certificate expires.
    Certificate Subject

    The subject to be protected by this certificate.
    The following example shows the Service Details section for a vNode:
Parent topic: Device Configuration and Management
